title: Linux iptables-save Command with Practical Examples
description: This lab explores the iptables-save command, which allows you to backup and restore iptables firewall rules. Learn how to use iptables-save for effective firewall management and automation.

meta.title: Linux iptables-save Command with Practical Examples

meta.keywords: iptables, firewall, backup, restore, automation, networking, security

steps.title: Understand the Purpose and Functionality of iptables-save

verify.name: Verify iptables-save command output
verify.hint: The iptables-save command should output the current firewall rules, including some ACCEPT rules. Verify that the output contains the expected rules.

steps.title: Backup and Restore iptables Firewall Rules Using iptables-save

verify.name: Verify iptables-restore command
verify.hint: The iptables -L command should show the restored firewall rules, including some ACCEPT rules. Verify that the output contains the expected rules.

steps.title: Automate iptables-save in a Systemd Service

verify.name: Verify iptables-save service
verify.hint: Verify that the iptables-save.service is enabled and running, and that the /etc/iptables/rules.v4 file contains the expected firewall rules.
